msContents.summary: A palm leaf manuscript of Kālidāsa's Vikramorvaśīya, complete in five acts (aṅkas). This manuscript includes the chāyās, i.e. the translations into Sanskrit of the Prakrit portions of the work.

msItem.title: Vikramorvaśīya
msItem.author: Kālidāsa
msItem.incipit:
vedānteṣu yam āhur ekapuruṣaṃ vyāpya sthitaṃ rodasī yasminn īśvara Ity ananyaviṣayaś śabdo yathārtthākṣaraḥ | Antaryyaś ca mumukṣubhir nniyamitaprāṇa
dibhir mmṛgyate sa sthāṇu sthirabhaktiyogasulabho niśreyasāyāstu vaḥ | nāndyante sūtradhāraḥ | sūtra | māriṣa Itas tāvat• | praviśya pāripapā
rśvakaḥ | bho Ayam asmi | sūtra - bahuśas tu pariṣadā pūrveṣāṃ kavīnān dṛṣṭaḥ prayogabandhaḥ | tad ahaṃ vikramorvaśīyyaṃ nāma nāṭakaṃ Apūrvaṃ
prayokṣye | tad ucyatāṃ pātravargaḥ | sveṣu sveṣu pāṭhyeṣv asammūḍhair bhavitavyam iti |

extent.measure: 1 guard folio inserted in the beginning of the bundle, 36 numbered folios, 2 guard folios inserted at the end of the bundle.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil numerals, on the left margin of the recto, 1 to 36.
supportDesc.condition: Good state of preservation, in spite of some bore holes produced by insects. The first two folios are cracked on the left side and a few syllables are lost.

handNote.desc: The name of the scribe is Śrīnivāsarāghavan. In the Prakrit sections, he tends to writes the anusvāra over the syllable instead of after it on the writing line.

additions.desc: On the outer face of the upper cover the title of the work (Vikramervaśīyyaṃ) and the name of the scribe (Śrīnivāsan) are recorded.

Two guard folios have been inserted at the end of the bundle. The first folio has unidentified text on both sides, in the Sanskrit language written in Grantha script. The second folio has unidentified text on the recto, in Sanskrit and Grantha script, and only a diagram on the verso. A date is written on the left side of the recto: virodhināmasaṃvatsaraṃ cāpaṃ tai ma - 46 .

The final cover is made of two folios glued together. The visible side of the inner folio also has unidentified text in Sanskrit language, written in Grantha script. On the outer face of the final cover the name of the scribe is recorded: śrīnivāsarāghavan_ ālekha pustakaṃ

binding.p: The covers are made up of thick, unprocessed palm leaves. In addition, an inscribed palm leaf as been glued to the final cover.

encodingDesc.p: Spaces added in transliteration where possible.
